text: Regulation of <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA expression by hydroxyurea in human K562 cells during erythroid differentiation [ published erratum appears in Biochim Biophys Acta 1995 Dec 27 ; 1264 ( 3 ) : 409 ]

text: Hydroxyurea ( HU ) is an antitumor agent which also induces hemoglobinization during erythroid differentiation .
In addition , HU stimulates the synthesis of fetal hemoglobin in sickle cell anemia patients .

To further understand its mechanism of action , we investigated the effects of HU on regulation of <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression prior to the onset of erythroid differentiation of K562 cells .

text: HU induced a dose - dependent stimulation of <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> synthesis .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation induced <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme stimulation <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation stimulation <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme synthesis <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Gene_expression synthesis <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme c-jun <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: The levels of <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA was elevated 4 to 7.5-fold by HU within 2 h .

This was followed by a gradual decline to the basal level by 24 h . Both nuclear run-on and actinomycin D pulse experiments strongly indicate that HU regulates <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA expression by increasing the rate of synthesis as well as stabilizing the <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA .

text: In addition , the level of jun protein was elevated by 2 to 5-fold within 4 h in HU treated cells .
Furthermore , concentrations of HU below 250 microM slightly increased the 5X AP-1 / CAT activity .
These results strongly suggest that HU induces both transcriptional and post-transcription regulation of <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> during erythroid differentiation .
